intro: Randia uncata, commonly known as the narrowleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually white or pale yellow, with four petals. Randia uncata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
